column5: I am thinking of going out to new bruinswick or nova scotia this summer and want to try some deepsea fishing.  I  have fished before down south but not up here.  I 've done some searching but didnt come up with much.  Let me know if anyone has fished out that way and their experiences, or if you have any suggestions on a great fishing trip!  Salmon, shark, cod, sturgeon........i'm up for anything out of my ordinary bass, pike type of fishing. thanks for any info mike
blue shark charters is one i know of, from fishermans cove. theres another one that goes after porbeagle sharks from the bay of fundy. www.sharksunlimited.ca

Contact Art at Blue Shark Charters (902) 830-4115.  He is the best!  I have fished in many countries and with many guides and he is simply on a different level.  He has only the best equipment and takes every precaution possible to insure everybodies safety.  I fish with him for a couple of days every year.  The last time I was out I caught a 310 pound Blue that was just over 10 feet long.  It took me just over 2 hours.  You can see it on the "Getting Hooked" website in the archived episodes.  That should give you a good idea of what fishing with Art is all about.  Mitch
I saw a show that the Fishin' Canada guys did with Sharks Unlimited. They got thier   kicked by some huge sharks.
We have world class bluefin tuna fishing over there!!!Giant fish!
thanks, ill check those out.  Any other ideas like salmon fly fishing or anything else to do out there??
during the spring and fall u can get some great striper fishing in the rivers. would imagine u can get them in the summer as well, just gotta talk to the rite ppl down there.
The fishin' canada show said sharks unlimited is the only licensed company capable of shark fishing off the east coast in canada.
As Karl said, blue fin tuna will make a boy out of a man. I have heard first hand of fights that last over 24 hours!
Take a look at the getting hooked trip for blues.......they looked like they had a good time!!  http://www.gettinghooked.net/Episodes_2008.html
Iv always wanted to try shark fihsing but I plan to go cage diving this Fall.

I remember seeing a show where Lee Wulf was fishing blue fin tuna. The shot I still remember nearly 30 years after seeing the show was aired was a shot from the fly bridge of an umbrella rig in the prop wash and the head of a 1000# tuna came out of no where. The head on it was the size of a volkswagon and it had an eye as big as a dinner plate. Awesome!!!!!!
well , i contacted sharks unlimited and they are all booked for the year.  so looks like that ones out
Did you contact Blue Shark Charters?
they have not got back to me yet.  If I cant get a charter I might go fly fishing for salmon, sea kayak the bay of fundy , eat lots of lobster and golf on an ocean course instead.
